Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of a Mobile Web Application to Enhance Knowledge of Increased Risk Donors Among Kidney Transplant Candidates

Trial_Design.evidence: In this multisite randomised controlled trial, KTCs undergoing evaluation at two transplant centers were randomised

Participants.evidence: KTCs undergoing evaluation at two transplant centers

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either the Inform Me application following routine transplant education (intervention) or routine education alone (control)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the efficacy of a mobile web application, Inform Me, in enhancing KTCs' knowledge about IRDs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was knowledge about IRDs, assessed immediately after education (Tests 1 and 2) and one week later (Test 3).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 288 participants were randomised: 144 to the intervention and 144 to the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Intervention participants had significantly higher Test 1 knowledge scores (mean difference=6.61; 95% CI, 5.37â€“7.86) compared to controls.
